intro_text: r_c tastes the air and perks up - there's a squirrel nearby, nibbling the delicate new plant growth near the base of a tree!
decline_text: After a moment's deliberation, r_c decides to move on.

success_outcomes.text: The wind suddenly shifts, and the squirrel jerks its head up in alarm. r_c thinks fast, bolting to cut off its escape before delivering the killing blow.
Though it tries to escape, r_c is faster and smarter - {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/slam/slams} a paw down on the squirrel's tail before it can go very far and {VERB/p_l/kill/kills}s it with ease.
s_c slinks through the underbrush, undetected until {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'ve/'s} pounced - and by then it's far too late for the squirrel to do anything about it.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c breaks a twig as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/ready/readies} {PRONOUN/r_c/self} to pounce, and the resulting crack alerts the squirrel. It doesn't even spare {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} a glance as it scurries up the tree and out of sight.

intro_text: app1 scents a squirrel on the air! This could be a great chance to bring one of the first big pieces of fresh-kill home...
decline_text: {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/decide/decides} to move on and ignore the squirrel for now.

success_outcomes.text: app1 slides into a hunting pose, trying not to focus too hard on making it perfect. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} right not to - {PRONOUN/app1/poss} catch is flawless, and {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/return/returns} home with {PRONOUN/app1/poss} chest puffed out in pride.

log.cats_from: from_cat saw to_cat come back from a solo-hunt with a squirrel for the fresh-kill pile.

success_outcomes.text: Though {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} a little sloppy, and the squirrel quickly spots {PRONOUN/app1/object}, app1 manages to secure the catch in the end!

log.cats_from: from_cat saw to_cat come back from a solo-hunt with a squirrel for the fresh-kill pile.

fail_outcomes.text: Poor app1 focuses too hard on making sure {PRONOUN/app1/poss} hunting crouch is correct - by the time {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/feel/feels} ready, the squirrel is long gone.

intro_text: p_l instructs app1 to scent the air and nods in approval when app1 says {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/smell/smells} squirrel. Early newleaf squirrels are always a good target - p_l softly murmurs tips to app1 and asks what {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/want/wants} to do.
decline_text: app1 looks apprehensive, then quietly says {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/want/wants} to look for something easier.

success_outcomes.text: app1 slides into a hunting pose, trying not to focus too hard on making it perfect. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} right not to - {PRONOUN/app1/poss} catch is flawless, and {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/puff/puffs} {PRONOUN/app1/poss} chest out in pride as p_l praises {PRONOUN/app1/object}.

log.cats_from: from_cat helped to_cat catch a squirrel.
to_cat helped from_cat catch a squirrel.

success_outcomes.text: Though {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} a little sloppy, and the squirrel quickly spots {PRONOUN/app1/object}, app1 manages to secure the catch in the end! p_l looks pleased and gives {PRONOUN/app1/object} tips to improve {PRONOUN/app1/poss} technique next time.

log.cats_from: from_cat helped to_cat catch a squirrel.
to_cat helped from_cat catch a squirrel.

fail_outcomes.text: A too-high tail brushing against the bushes scares the squirrel away, and app1 watches in disappointment as it scampers off.

log.cats_from: from_cat was embarrassed to miss a squirrel in front of to_cat, especially during leaf-bare.

intro_text: As the patrol walks through the forest, a loud chittering from above interrupts them. r_c looks up just in time to get a shower of twigs and leaves to the face, while p_l exclaims aloud when {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/spot/spots} squirrels darting through the branches above.
decline_text: Though they snort in amusement, the patrol decides to move on to easier prey, rather than waste their energy amongst the trees.

success_outcomes.text: Before anyone can even speak, there's a loud crack from above. The cats scatter as a branch crashes down, bringing both squirrels and a shower of oak leaves with it! The patrol thinks fast and pounces on the squirrels before they can escape. They head home with their bounty, each cat feeling quite pleased with themself.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat enjoyed a successful hunt together.

success_outcomes.text: A mischievous look in {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} eye, p_l challenges {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} Clanmates - whoever catches one of the squirrels gets to skip dawn patrol for a whole moon. They're all eager to shimmy up the trees at that, and before long r_c calls out in triumph. Not only do they have the squirrel, but they also now have a pawful of oak leaves for the medicine cat as well!

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat engaged in a friendly hunting competition together.
from_cat felt more confident in to_cat's loyalty after seeing {PRONOUN/to_cat/object} gather oak leaves for the medicine cat.
from_cat enjoyed the little challenge that to_cat set to the patrol when they were hunting together.

success_outcomes.text: With a glint in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} eye, s_c is up in the trees before anyone can say anything. There's rustling, a short pause, then squirrel carcasses begin falling to the ground, one by one. s_c descends when {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'ve/'s} finished with a mouthful of oak leaves, curling {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} tail in pride at the looks on {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmates' faces.

log.cats_from: ...and thought {PRONOUN/to_cat/subject} {VERB/to_cat/were/was} bragging about it a little more than necessary.
from_cat watched to_cat catch squirrel after squirrel on a hunting patrol...

fail_outcomes.text: Though the cats try to climb the trees in pursuit, the squirrels are much more suited to running along the branches, and they easily leave the patrol floundering as they disappear into the distance.

log.cats_from: from_cat doubted to_cat's hunting skill after a disappointing hunting patrol.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol fans out, some cats climbing, some staying on the ground. The hunt comes to an abrupt end, however, when r_c yowls in fear as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/plummet/plummets} from the branches and {VERB/r_c/land/lands} heavily on the ground. {PRONOUN/r_c/poss/CAP} Clanmates help {PRONOUN/r_c/object} home and settle {PRONOUN/r_c/object} into the medicine cat den, guilt and regret prickling at them for pursuing such a foolhardy hunt.

relationships.log: from_cat and to_cat avoided each other after a disastrous squirrel hunting patrol.

intro_text: As the patrol walks through the woods, r_c explains an idea {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} had for squirrel hunting. It sounds a little strange, but perhaps it could work?
decline_text: The patrol decides they'd rather not spend time on something that might not work when they could be doing something they know does.

success_outcomes.text: r_c suggests baiting the squirrels with food and picking them off when they come out to eat. It's pretty tedious, and they end up having to move a few times, but it does work, and the patrol heads home with a decent amount of prey.

log.cats_from: from_cat was impressed by to_cat's idea for baiting squirrels.

success_outcomes.text: r_c suggests baiting the squirrels with food and picking them off when they come out to eat. Waiting is the most difficult part; the squirrels don't seem to expect the trap, and they come home laden with prey.

log.cats_from: from_cat was impressed by to_cat's clever idea for baiting squirrels.

success_outcomes.text: r_c suggests baiting the squirrels with food and picking them off when they come out to eat. All the patrol has to do is set the trap - with s_c on the patrol, they rarely have to lift a paw, and each cat carries multiple squirrels home.

log.cats_from: from_cat was highly impressed by to_cat's genius idea for baiting squirrels.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c suggests finding squirrels sheltered in trees, climbing above them, and shaking the branches to scare them down. Unfortunately for them, the idea is a little too far out there, and while they do manage a few small catches, the day is mostly wasted with little to show for it.

log.cats_from: from_cat felt that to_cat wasted a perfectly good hunting patrol with a hare-brained squirrel-baiting scheme.

intro_text: The patrol comes across a squirrel. It's engrossed in nibbling at a morsel beneath a tree.
decline_text: The patrol ignores the squirrel.

success_outcomes.text: Stealthily, r_c stalks forward. The squirrel has no idea what's coming as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/pounce/pounces} on it and {VERB/r_c/break/breaks} its neck. r_c sends a silent thanks to StarClan for this prey.

r_c rapidly pads towards the squirrel, {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tailtip twitching in excitement. The squirrel is alerted to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} presence by a bird's alarm call, but r_c launches {PRONOUN/r_c/self} forward and cuts off its escape with a bite to the back of the head.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol narrowly misses the squirrel as it's alerted by a bird's alarm call.

intro_text: As the patrol wanders through a damp, dripping world, their claws clogged with mud, p_l turns around to find r_c is missing.
decline_text: r_c eventually catches up.

success_outcomes.text: r_c seems confused when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/come/comes} trotting up, responding to p_l's yowls. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} thought this was the hunting spot? Situation solved, p_l decides it may as well be, and the patrol disperses to do their actual job. It doesn't turn out to be a particularly bountiful corner of the woods though.

log.cats_from: from_cat learned that to_cat is good at finding hunting spots while patrolling together.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol finds r_c at the bottom of a precarious looking embankment, and r_c encourages them to join {PRONOUN/r_c/object} - r_c has found a fallen bird's nest and needs help carrying the delicious nestlings back to camp.

log.cats_from: to_cat found a nest full of baby birds while patrolling with from_cat. The memory always makes from_cat lick {PRONOUN/from_cat/poss} lips.

success_outcomes.text: It's not ideal. s_c apologizes - {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/were/was} too caught up in assessing the prey levels in the sheltered group of aspens and hadn't realized the patrol moved on. But all is forgiven easily with the discovery of such a great hunting spot.

log.cats_from: from_cat was pleased when to_cat found a great hunting spot among a group of aspens on a hunting patrol.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol finds where r_c has wandered off to, but it takes too much time, and no one accomplishes much of anything. There's a lot of grumbling as the cats return home.

log.cats_from: to_cat wandered off during a hunting patrol, irritating from_cat.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l, leading the search for r_c, hears a yowl in the distance. It's r_c, drenched and mud-soaked at the bottom of a steep embankment. The patrol works to rescue {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, calling off their hunt.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred after disappearing on patrol and being discovered injured.

log.cats_from: from_cat doubted to_cat's ability to handle {PRONOUN/to_cat/self} on a patrol when {PRONOUN/to_cat/subject} ended up at the bottom of a muddy ditch.

intro_text: p_l makes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} way towards a blooming grove of trees. {PRONOUN/p_l/poss/CAP} ears perk at the sound of a soft hiss on the wind.
decline_text: Whatever it was, it was too small to feed the Clan.

success_outcomes.text: p_l turns around in time to see a rat chasing after {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} tail. A quick slash of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} claws, and the rat is now just another meal for the Clan.

p_l crouches low to the ground and stalks close to the bushes, seeing a rat nibbling on a small seed. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/lunge/lunges} forward and {VERB/p_l/bite/bites} down into the rat's neck.

s_c notices the nibbled shells of tree nuts and stalks closer, silent as the night. A rat is searching for food on the forest floor. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/pounce/pounces} before the rodent can react, cutting off its squeak of alarm with a bite to the neck. A moment later, the leaves to s_c's right rustle, and without thinking, the cat slams {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} paw down just as a second rat bolts away. Two pieces of fresh-kill with one pounce!

fail_outcomes.text: p_l turns around in time to see a rat chasing after {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} tail! {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/attempt/attempts} to slash into its fur, but the rat quickly avoids {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} claws and darts away. Mouse-dung!

intro_text: p_l makes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} way towards a large mossy log, eager to make the Clan proud with this hunting assessment! A soft scratching could be heard inside.
decline_text: p_l decides against hunting in the log and travels further into the grove to find suitable prey.

success_outcomes.text: p_l charges into the log and surprises the rat inside! The two have a harsh battle, but the rat was no match for an apprentice of c_n!

log.cats_from: from_cat was impressed by the fat rat to_cat caught all by {PRONOUN/to_cat/self}.

success_outcomes.text: p_l waits carefully until {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/see/sees} the rat leave the log. A perfect landing on the rat makes it seem like kit's play. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to c_n's camp with {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head held high.

log.cats_from: from_cat was impressed by the fat rat to_cat caught all by {PRONOUN/to_cat/self}.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l waits patiently for the prey to come out of the log... long enough that {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} eyes flutter shut and {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} fall asleep! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/wake/wakes} up later to see {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mentor standing over {PRONOUN/r_c/object} in disappointment.

log.cats_from: from_cat wasn't impressed to hear to_cat fell asleep during a solo-hunt.

intro_text: p_l and app1 make their way towards a blooming grove of trees, listening to the chittering prey in the branches. p_l spots a rat near a mossy stump and challenges app1 to catch it.
decline_text: app1 shakes {PRONOUN/app1/poss} head, noting that the prey in the trees would be a much easier target. The two leave the rat behind.

success_outcomes.text: app1 lowers {PRONOUN/app1/self} into a hunting crouch and slowly stalks towards the rat. Leaping upwards onto the mossy stump, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/crash/crashes} into the rat and {VERB/app1/knock/knocks} it onto the ground. A quick bite, and a nod of approval from p_l, makes {PRONOUN/app1/object} purr in triumph.

log.cats_from: from_cat was proud of to_cat for catching a rat.

success_outcomes.text: app1 nods and strays behind the mossy stump, watching the rat nibbling on a small seed. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/race/races} forward and {VERB/app1/bite/bites} down on the rat's neck. p_l nods and herds the patrol forward. One rat wouldn't be enough to feed the whole Clan, after all.

log.cats_from: from_cat was proud of to_cat for catching a rat.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 nods and crouches to get closer to the rat, but a twig snapping underneath {PRONOUN/app1/poss} paw causes the rat to flee. p_l shakes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head.

log.cats_from: from_cat was embarrassed to miss a rat in front of p_l.

intro_text: r_c calls the patrol to {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, explaining {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} plan. An abandoned Twoleg nest has been spotted on the territory by the border patrols, brimming with rats! It would be the perfect place for some newleaf hunting!
decline_text: The other cats disagree with such a risk and resume their normal hunting patrol.

success_outcomes.text: r_c leads the patrol towards the nest, pushing past the rotting wood blocking the entrance. The patrol gets to work rounding up and piling up the rats, and by nightfall they have so much it takes two trips to bring them back! r_c is congratulated for {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} ingenious plan.

log.cats_from: to_cat's risky plan to hunt rats in an abandoned Twoleg nest paid off, and from_cat reaped the benefits.

success_outcomes.text: r_c leads the patrol towards the nest, and they quickly get to work hunting down the rats cornered near the smooth stones. It's a tough fight, with rats attempting to flee or attack the patrol, but in the end the patrol amasses a hefty pile of prey for c_n.

log.cats_from: to_cat led from_cat in a fight against some rats, and they brought back heaps of prey.

success_outcomes.text: s_c tells the others to flank the house and they go in carefully, quietly. With a flick of the tail to signal, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/leads/lead} the patrol in cornering the rats and picking them off as they try to flee, collecting quite a feast.

log.cats_from: to_cat's hunting skill helped from_cat's patrol bring back a huge haul of rats.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol drives the rats back into the Twoleg nest, each cat guarding an escape route. p_l runs ahead, startling the rats into a scurry where s_c is ready to dispatch them. It's going to take a few trips to get all these rats home.

log.cats_from: from_cat startled rats into to_cat's claws, and they both felt pleased with each other's efforts.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c leads the cats to the abandoned Twoleg nest, but as the cats search and search, all they can find are abandoned rat nests. r_c is scolded for wasting the patrol's valuable time.

log.cats_from: to_cat convinced from_cat to search an abandoned Twoleg nest for rats, but it was a waste of time.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c leads the cats to the abandoned Twoleg nest, but the rats are livelier than {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} expected. A harsh battle forces the patrol to retreat, r_c being the most grievously wounded.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from fighting a swarm of rats.

intro_text: A legend has been sighted. Recently, warriors have reported sighting a strange mass of rats stuck together by their tails, larger and more dangerous than anything the Clan has seen. Will p_l's patrol look for this legendary monster?
decline_text: No. Such a thing can't exist, right? It has to be an elder's imagination. p_l decides to take {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} patrol elsewhere to hunt.

success_outcomes.text: The Rat King's lair is heavily defended by smaller rats. While the patrol doesn't find any sign of the Rat King, they manage to defeat and bring back a feast of small rats.

The rats defending the Rat King's lair are more numerous than they thought. The patrol catches whatever rats they can, but p_l swears that they saw it - multiple eyes glowing in the dark, watching them.

The waves of rats overwhelm the rest of the patrol, but s_c can see the Rat King writhing within its nest. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/bolt/bolts} away from the others, trusting {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} claws to take on the legend. It dies with a horrible shriek, as the rest of the patrol watch in awe.

log.cats_from: from_cat witnessed the birth of a legend when to_cat killed the Rat King.
from_cat watches to_cat and {PRONOUN/to_cat/poss} patrol return triumphant from the vanquishing of the Rat King.

fail_outcomes.text: There are more rats defending the Rat King's lair than they thought. Fighting off waves of them, the patrol retreats back to the Clan with empty paws.
The Rat King and their minions overwhelm the patrol, biting into fur and limbs. p_l orders a retreat, and {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/hope/hopes} the Clan can heal so many wounded.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred fighting a Rat King.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c knows {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/are/is} one of the Clan's greatest hunters. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/spot/spots} the Rat King and {VERB/s_c/charge/charges} into its lair. But the King proves too great a foe for a single cat, and it sends s_c back with wounds to tell {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} tale.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred fighting a Rat King.

log.cats_from: from_cat heard to_cat's stories of facing the Rat King.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c knows {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/are/is} one of the Clan's greatest hunters. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/spot/spots} the Rat King and {VERB/s_c/charge/charges} into its lair. But the King proves too great a foe for a single cat, and it kills the would-be kingslayer.

history_text.death: m_c died from {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} wounds after battling a Rat King.

intro_text: Something skitters across newly sprouted grass, catching the patrol's eyes. A little lizard!
decline_text: Startled by the lizard, the patrol watches it scurry away.

success_outcomes.text: r_c pounces on the little creature! The nice mouthful is a great start to what turns into a decent hunting patrol, giving them a chance to stretch their legs and get out of camp as the weather improves.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat enjoyed their hunt together.

success_outcomes.text: The lizard drops its tail, and r_c dives for it, while p_l pounces for the lizard. Surely this counts for two catches? Neither of them cares much, and it's a happy afternoon hunting together.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat shared a laugh after catching two ends of a lizard.

success_outcomes.text: s_c is basically on top of the skittering lizard and does a ridiculous hop to come down on it with claws extended. r_c compliments {PRONOUN/s_c/object} on the catch with a laugh in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} meow, and s_c has to agree with {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, purring with amusement.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat shared a silly hunt together.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol is unable to catch the small reptile quick enough, and the little lizard lives another day.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat avoided each other after an embarrassing hunt.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c and p_l go for the prey at the same time, bonking their heads together. Not a bad collision, and both of them are mature enough to let it go, but neither is pleased to have missed an easy catch.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat avoided each other after an embarrassing hunt.

intro_text: Something skitters across newly sprouted grass, catching the patrol's eyes. A little lizard!
decline_text: Startled by the lizard, the patrol watches it scurry away.

log.cats_from: Though they didn't catch much, from_cat and to_cat got to chat and enjoy a forest walk together.

success_outcomes.text: app1 and app2 go for the prey at the same time, bonking their heads together. It makes both of them laugh while apologizing, and they don't leave each other's side for the rest of the patrol, apologies turning to chatting turning to whispered conversations.

log.cats_from: After bonking heads on a hunt, from_cat and to_cat ended up growing much closer together.

intro_text: r_c catches scent of a mouse nearby. A perfect opportunity to pick up one of the first bounties newleaf brings to the forest.
decline_text: r_c ignores the mouse.

success_outcomes.text: r_c locates the mouse and begins to stalk. The mouse nibbles on a seed, unaware of the hunting cat. r_c waggles {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} haunches and leaps, pinning the mouse beneath a paw as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/make/makes} the killing bite.

r_c pinpoints the location of the prey and begins creeping forward. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} almost within pouncing distance when the mouse bolts. With a lash of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tail, r_c leaps after the mouse, snagging it just before it reaches a burrow. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/purr/purrs} in satisfaction as prey-blood hits {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tongue.
s_c immediately drops into a practiced crouch, shimmying flawlessly along the ground and taking the perfectly plump mouse completely by surprise.

intro_text: As the patrol heads out into the forest to hunt, r_c seems to be absolutely unconcerned with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} duties, instead ambling along as through the prey is going to waltz into {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} paws.
decline_text: The cats are called back to camp - there's something the deputy needs to discuss with them.

success_outcomes.text: r_c makes it look easy, and when the patrol is done mousing everyone else ends up carrying catches mostly brought down by {PRONOUN/r_c/object}. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/lead/leads} the way back to camp, sauntering with a distinctly smug sway of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} hips.

log.cats_from: ...but to_cat undeniably looked good doing it.
from_cat was annoyed by to_cat's cocky attitude during a hunting patrol...

success_outcomes.text: Of course s_c is unconcerned, s_c knows {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} own skills well, and mice? Not a challenge. After {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} fifth catch, the rest of the patrol is forced to admit {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} might have a point about not needing to worry.

log.cats_from: ...but to_cat undeniably looked good doing it.
from_cat was annoyed by to_cat's cocky attitude during a hunting patrol...

success_outcomes.text: The patrol settles into the hunt, following the scents of mice. s_c wanders back, and as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/put/puts} a paw down, the ground squeaks. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/lean/leans} down, jaws snapping, and {VERB/s_c/meet/meets} the eyes of the rest of the patrol with an insolent smirk.

log.cats_from: ...but to_cat undeniably looked good doing it.
from_cat was annoyed by to_cat's cocky attitude during a hunting patrol...

fail_outcomes.text: r_c doesn't bring much home, impressing nobody.

intro_text: As the patrol heads out into the forest to hunt, r_c suggests a sheltered gully. It's a little far from camp, but the hunting around there is good, particularly for mice.
decline_text: The cats are called back to camp - there's something the deputy needs to discuss with them.

success_outcomes.text: As they arrive, the patrol startles two mice, and r_c reacts quick enough with an inelegant pounce to kill one. It's a good omen for the rest of the morning's work, which proves to be a productive and satisfying hunt.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat shared a satisfying hunt together.

success_outcomes.text: The cats sneak into the hunting grounds, ears rotating as different spots catch their interest. r_c's suggestion proves to be a fruitful hunting ground, one that c_n hasn't used for a while and whose creatures (as predicted, nearly all mice) have lost their edge of wariness. It's a good hunt.

log.cats_from: to_cat picked a good hunting location for from_cat's hunting patrol.

success_outcomes.text: These are the times that it really pays to have a hunter of s_c's caliber on the patrol - {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} really {VERB/s_c/go/goes} above and beyond, impressing everyone and leaving a trail of terror among the local mice.

log.cats_from: from_cat gained a greater respect for to_cat's hunting skills while hunting mice together.

fail_outcomes.text: Ah. r_c's suggested hunting grounds don't work out, not that anyone blames {PRONOUN/r_c/object} for it.

log.cats_from: to_cat's poor choice of hunting grounds wasted from_cat's time on a hunting patrol.

intro_text: As r_c sets off to see what {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can find for the fresh-kill pile, the newleaf sun feels weak, but the grass is sprouting and the trees of the forest are coated in mangy pelts of not-quite-unfurled leaf buds. Let's see what {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can rustle up.
decline_text: While on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} way to a likely hunting ground, r_c notices the pawprints of a large, clawed animal crossing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} path. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP}'d better return to camp and report it instead.

success_outcomes.text: The forest is coming alive again after leaf-bare, but it's still recovering, and the f_tp_s r_c finds looks on the scrawny side. Still, together with an uncracked bird egg fallen from its nest, that's a decent contribution to bring back to camp.

r_c is very proud of the pounce that wins {PRONOUN/r_c/object} a f_tp_s, and tries to repeat the trick. On the one paw, it does work, gaining {PRONOUN/r_c/object} a f_tp_s for {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} prey haul, but that fantastic pounce also takes {PRONOUN/r_c/object} into a dirty pile of melting snow under a bush. Blegh. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} really thought {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'d be done with snow by now.

Finally! It felt like the snow would never clear. s_c ignores the odd dirty slush pile still trying to hold out in the most sheltered spots under evergreen trees, telling {PRONOUN/s_c/self} those are probably mostly mud by now anyway, and cheerfully brings back to c_n camp a full haul of several f_tp_p and a plump f_tp_s.

s_c pads carefully around the signs of the strengthening sun, avoiding what seems like an endless series of puddles and washed-out trails to carefully make {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} way to a small meadow hemmed in by the trees. In the clearing in the forest, the sun has been left unimpeded to call grass from dormancy, and it makes for a productive hunting spot, with s_c bringing home a f_tp_s and two f_tp_p.

fail_outcomes.text: Maybe it was a bad idea hunting on an empty stomach - there's little cover from the forest right now, and r_c gets spotted every time they start a stalk.

When {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/round/rounds} a bend in the path, r_c hears a bird call. Jerking {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} head up, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/lose/loses} {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} footing and {VERB/r_c/skid/skids} down a slope more mud than grass. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} not that badly hurt, but r_c is tender enough after that fall to give up and go home.
s_c, overconfident, tries to jump a muddy puddle, doesn't make it, and slides face first into a tree. Also there's snow within the puddle, not quite melted. Fantastic.

intro_text: app1, hearing the rest of camp gossiping about the good hunting newleaf will bring, thinks it's worth a shot going out into the soggy forest by {PRONOUN/app1/self}. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/want/wants} to prove that {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'ve/'s} gotten better at stalking.
decline_text: ...Maybe it'd be better to wait until {PRONOUN/app1/poss} mentor is free to take {PRONOUN/app1/object} on a hunting patrol.

success_outcomes.text: There's no snow. That's so obvious that app1 feels embarrassed for thinking it, but - there's no snow. And it's so warm, app1 doesn't even mind all the mud the rest of the Clan is so upset about - at least it's not cold anymore. Stalking through a tangle of evergreen trees, app1 finds a good f_mp_s.

Perhaps {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/need/needs} to ask {PRONOUN/app1/poss} mentor about working on {PRONOUN/app1/poss} killing technique next - the f_tp_s {PRONOUN/app1/subject} found by a rotting log sort of had half its head caved in, and if {PRONOUN/app1/subject} hadn't snagged the leg of the f_tp_s {PRONOUN/app1/subject} found by a big oak tree, it would've gotten away. Still, app1 is proud to bring these back to the fresh-kill pile all by {PRONOUN/app1/self}.

app1 carefully skirts the seas of mud that have replaced the snowdrifts, not knowing which {PRONOUN/app1/subject} preferred. But it's difficult to be too upset by it, not when the sun is shining and the birds are out singing and app1 has a f_mp_s to bring home to the fresh-kill pile in front of the whole Clan.

log.cats_from: from_cat was impressed by to_cat's focus and success on a solo-hunt.

app1 heads out confidently, sure that the bounties of newleaf will make this hunt easy. While pouncing for a bird, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/slip/slips} and {VERB/app1/fall/falls} into a muddy puddle, landing awkwardly. To add insult to injury, the bird makes dirt on {PRONOUN/app1/poss} head. Great.

log.cats_from: from_cat was highly entertained to see to_cat come back to camp with bird dirt on {PRONOUN/to_cat/poss} head.

intro_text: Leading the way into the forest, p_l calls back to the two apprentices, telling them there's a treat in store for them - finally it's newleaf, which means it's time for the young cats to pick up on one of the quintessential c_n skills - nest raiding!
decline_text: The cats are called back to camp - there's something the deputy needs to discuss with them.

success_outcomes.text: As they walk, the warriors chat, passing on tips in what's as much gossip as a lesson. app1 and app2 are far too busy to speak, eyes fixed on the trees. app2 is stopped before {PRONOUN/app2/subject} can walk into a puddle and gently reminded to watch {PRONOUN/app2/poss} paws a little more. Both apprentices are thrilled to be allowed the first shot, sneaking upwards to scoop fragile eggs out of stick piles, trying not to drool over the shells.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat enjoyed raiding nests in newleaf together.

success_outcomes.text: r_c spots a great hole in the trunk of an oak, and together the hunting patrol shimmer up into the branches, teasing app1 for accidentally breaking one of the eight big eggs inside. p_l tells the apprentices that with this many big eggs, the nest they're raiding is probably that of a bird of prey - always good to have fewer of those in c_n's territory. They even bring back some oak leaves with them, though it's a real struggle holding them with the eggs!

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat enjoyed raiding nests in newleaf together.

success_outcomes.text: s_c has a great eye for spotting nests, but {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/stay/stays} back, remembering the thrill (and also relative safety) of nest raiding as an apprentice. app1 and app2 get all the credit for their climbing skills, and s_c is more than content with the grateful look the other warrior throws {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} way.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat enjoyed raiding nests in newleaf together.
from_cat noticed that to_cat let the rest of the patrol raid nests in newleaf.

success_outcomes.text: It's a wonderful day, wandering through the sunshine kind of randomly around c_n's forest searching for the signs of bird nests and swarming up the trees for them. s_c is even able to show off a little, inching out onto the spindly branches of a willow to snag a hard-to-reach nest.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat enjoyed raiding nests in newleaf together.
from_cat was impressed by to_cat's daring while raiding nests in newleaf.

fail_outcomes.text: The wind starts to pick up, and, alarmed, p_l stops the nest raiding plans in their tracks. There's no reason to risk themselves on thin branches in bad weather - the nests will be stocked full of eggs or nestlings to make off with all newleaf, and p_l well remembers the tales the elders tell of foolish risks taken for stupidly small rewards.

log.cats_from: from_cat appreciated that to_cat canceled a patrol instead of risking tree-climbing in high winds.

intro_text: As r_c sharpens {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} claws on a tree root, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/spot/spots} a pair of birds furiously chattering to each other above {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, puffing up their feathers and singing in territorial fury. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} could go after the birds, of course - but if the fluffy mouthfuls are being protective, then there's something to protect, and it's the season for nest raiding.
decline_text: But r_c can't be bothered today, not with the newleaf sun so bright and warm. Another time, perhaps.

success_outcomes.text: It takes a little time to find a nest, but r_c manages it, and it's worth it for the hunt it offers. r_c would have to be concussed to fail to reach this nest, since the birds have done a terrible job choosing its location. The blackbird incubating its eggs can only flee to another branch and chatter angrily as r_c carefully removes the eggs one by one. All three will make a delicacy of a meal for someone back at camp.

The beech tree these sparrows have chosen to nest in is a popular choice, and as birds continue to fight with their neighbors, r_c slips into the tree to take advantage, emptying nest after nest through the ineffectual outraged squawking protests of their owners. These birds will lay again before the season is out - r_c will have to remember this tree.

s_c hops confidently into the trees to hunt, taking {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} time picking out the nests among the branches. It's difficult not to drool all over the eggs {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/steal/steals}, looking forward to the little feast of the well-loved delicacies {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}'ll be able to have with {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmates.

fail_outcomes.text: Unfortunately, the squabbling birds have managed to construct their homes on branches thin and high enough that r_c can't justify the risk, not even for those delicious, perfect eggs.

Full of mouth-watering desire for the rich yolk of eggs, r_c risks venturing out onto a thin spindly branch. Too spindly, in fact, and though {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/catch/catches} {PRONOUN/r_c/self} on a lower branch with a scrabbling struggle, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'ll be feeling that tonight when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/stretch/stretches} out in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} nest. Ow.

Full of mouth-watering desire for the rich egg yolks, r_c risks venturing out onto a thin spindly branch. Too spindly, in fact. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/topple/topples} from the treetop, clawing desperately, fruitlessly for a hold on the branches {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} whip past, gaining speed as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} whirl {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} body around until {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/see/sees} the ground approaching.

success_outcomes.text: The branches of the pine are slippery with rain, but the bark is rough and steady under r_c's paws. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} only able to pick up two eggs. Still, that's two more than the Clan started the day with.

r_c finds a nest that the weather has blown out of the tree and takes it as a sign from StarClan. Thanking {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} ancestors for the food of the unbroken eggs within, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} also {VERB/r_c/murmur/murmurs} thanks for the warning and {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to camp, pelt prickling with the thought that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} might have just as easily been blown out of the treetops as this nest was.

Keeping {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} balance and nerve on branches slicked down with pouring rain requires all of s_c's skill and experience, and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/return/returns} to camp with eggs, yes, but also with a pelt fluffed out with stress and fright.

s_c wanders out into the territory to search, but the driving rain and the rustle of the wind through the branches is too much, too obvious a danger, and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/return/returns} back to camp empty-pawed.

intro_text: app1 has ears, of course {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'ve/'s} heard the rest of c_n buzzing about the nest raiding season, and {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/see/sees} no reason {PRONOUN/app1/subject} should be left out of it!

success_outcomes.text: It's amazing that birds just leave these lying about! app1 finds a low-hanging nest, shoos away the sparrow, and trots home with the eggs, one by one adding them to the fresh-kill pile, fluffing out {PRONOUN/app1/poss} chest fur in pride.

Going out by {PRONOUN/app1/self} makes everything much harder, and instead of fishing eggs out, app1 accidentally knocks {PRONOUN/app1/poss} target nest out of the tree. But at least a couple of the eggs are unbroken, and that's better than nothing. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/lap/laps} up the yolk from the broken eggs - better than letting them go to waste!

It doesn't take long to find a nest, positioned high in the crook between two thin branches of a hazelnut tree. But app1 isn't confident {PRONOUN/app1/subject} can safely make that climb. Instead, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/grab/grabs} a stick and {VERB/app1/jab/jabs} at the nest from further away, sending it plummeting out of the tree. Some of the eggs inside are smashed open, but there's still a couple left to bring home.

fail_outcomes.text: Step one: find nests... has conclusively failed. At least {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} alone though - app1 trips over a branch on the forest floor as {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/walk/walks} with {PRONOUN/app1/poss} eyes pinned skyward, and {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} grateful no one was there to see it.

It doesn't take long to find a nest, positioned high in the crook between two thin branches of a hazelnut tree. But app1 is confident {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} can safely make that climb! {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} rather less confident once up so high in the air, and eventually {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/retreat/retreats}, shaking.

Going out by {PRONOUN/app1/self} makes everything much harder, and instead of fishing eggs out, app1 accidentally knocks {PRONOUN/app1/poss} target nest and {PRONOUN/app1/self} out of the tree. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/hit/hits} the ground hard, hearing the crack of something breaking.

history_text.scar: m_c will always carry the scars from falling from the treetops while nest raiding alone as an apprentice.
